How to Know if you are getting the Best Deal from your Mechanic 
Finding the right auto mechanic can be a difficult process. I mean, who can you trust your car with? You want to make sure your ride is always in the best possible hands, but you also do not want to pay an unnecessary premium for such services, especially when the other guys may be better and cheaper. Luckily, we’ve found ways for you to know if you are getting the best deal from your auto mechanic. 
It is imperative when dealing with such, you do your research. Treat your mechanic, as you would a doctor. After all, it is like a doctor for your car. If you had a problem, you’d seek out the best person for the job. Luckily, there are great resources to look at. Most people won’t eat at a place unless they’ve looked up the Yelp reviews, so naturally, you should do the same when searching for a mechanic. Really look at what consumers have to say about the price range, and cross check those prices with the mechanics themselves! 
Also, do not be afraid to get second, third opinions even. Compare prices of various places, and contrast notes. How far does each dollar go at each auto shop in your area? What’s the going rate on average for the procedure you need? Go in knowing these figures to make sure nobody is ripping you off! Other auto specific websites like Edmunds.com, and also Angie’s List, which you’ve probably seen numerous television advertisements for. People are more honest, brutally honest even, under the guise and anonymity of the internet, so you can be sure that people are giving honest opinions about what they received for the price that they paid. 
On average, locally owned, family run places are known to give better deals than the big box or franchise who’s job is basically to rip you off. Someone doing honest work is more likely to give you an honest price. Plus, supporting a local business over a franchise is better for local commerce and community. Another good thing to keep in mind, is to be succinct and clear about what you want, and do not let them talk you into something you may not need. So keep your auto in tip top shape and never overpay for what you need!
